summary:
As a (policy) researcher I specialized in both qualitative and quantitative research methods, ranging from deskresearch, interview, observation, and interaction techniques (group decision, Delphi techniques) to a broad range of methods for statistical analysis. In my opinion for research to be truly valuable, both qualitative and quantitative approaches are indispensible. To make founded assumptions, ‘hard’ quantitative data are important. However, being able to give a reliable interpretation of these quantitative data requires a good understanding of the context. For me, linking these two approaches within a study is the biggest challenge as this link is necessary for translating research findings into practical, usable recommendations for policymakers. 

Keywords: monitoring and evaluation, policy research, impact studies, policy consultancy.

profile_positions.description:
Conducting a longitudinal study that aims to determine whether the education offered at the Hollandse school in Singapore (HSL) aligns with curricula used within international and Dutch schools, thus assuring student's smooth transition after they leave the HSL. 
Developing a study to obtain insight in the decision-making process of parents when selecting a suitable school for their children. How do they value and weigh various aspects when deciding for a specific school and is it possible to distinguish different target groups with distinct sets of wishes and motives.

profile_positions.description:
Policy research, policy consultancy, conducting qualitative and quantitative research in the areas of education, culture and welfare. Designing surveys, analysing results and writing reports and tenders/ project proposals. Supporting and counselling local authorities and institutions with policy making and adjusting existing policies based on the outcomes of research. 

Recent projects:
- Support and advise local organisations and governments with policy-making and -conducting in the area of local educational policy and welfare/ youth policy.  
- Monitoring: designing, managing and implementing several policy monitors concerning local youth policies (defining indicators for outputs, outcomes and impacts, gathering data, structuring data files etc.). Advising authorities how to use this information to improve practices and activities.     
- Impact studies on the effects of several instruments, methodes and local policies aimed at improving education for specific target-groups.
Recent projects:
- Organizing a convention (700+ participants) for parties involved with local educational policy making (local governments, school boards, health and welfare institutions).

profile_positions.description:
Involved in a large number of performance audits aimed at national policies in the fields of social affairs, education, employment and culture. Organisational audits on several aspects of organisational management within the ministry of social affairs and employment. Conducting risk assessments and monitoring. Writing rapports and project proposals, answering questions posed by members of the National Parliament. 

Selection of audits:
- Audit to determine the effectiveness and efficiency of the National Broadcasting Services in the Netherlands (request of the National Parliament of the Netherlands);
- Investigating the policies of the National Government aimed at improving the position of unemployed citizens with a low level of education on the labour market.
- Study to the effectiveness of National policies to fight fraud of social services, tax
fraud and horizontal fraud;

Selection of research projects (in Dutch): 
- Onderzoek ‘De beroepspraktijkvorming in het MBO’. Kwantitatieve analyse van resultaten enquêteonderzoek onder een grote groep leerlingen, docenten en leerbedrijven. Dit onderzoek richtte zich op de wijze waarop Regionale Opleidingscentra en het regionale bedrijfsleven samenwerken om de praktijkcomponent (de stages) binnen het MBO onderwijs vorm te geven en de wijze waarop leerlingen op de stageplaats begeleid worden.
- Onderzoek Werklozen zonder startkwalificatie. Een onderzoek naar het beleid van de Rijksoverheid om de arbeidsmarktpositie van werklozen zonder startkwalificatie te verbeteren. Hoe geeft het Rijk invulling aan haar faciliterende en stimulerende rol? Dit onderzoek richtte zich eveneens op de wijze waarop regionale partijen samenwerken om voorzieningen ten behoeve van deze doelgroep op elkaar af te stemmen.
